title: Step 1: Pickup Point Dashboard placeholder page + authenticated route

requirements.summary: Create a placeholder Pickup Point Dashboard page component under shop pages with an H1 title and short description, and no data fetching.
acceptanceCriteria: A new page component exists under frontend/src/pages/shop for the pickup-point dashboard.
When rendered, the page shows a visible title (H1) and a short English placeholder description.
The page does not import or call any data-fetching hooks (React Query) or actor methods.
The page renders without runtime errors and uses existing layout conventions (e.g., container-custom + spacing) consistent with other shop pages.

file_operations.description: Create the PickupPointDashboardPage component rendering placeholder-only UI: a container-custom wrapper with existing spacing conventions (e.g., py-8 + space-y-*), a clear H1 title ("Pickup Point Dashboard") and a short English description indicating this is an upcoming dashboard. Do not import/use React Query hooks or actor calls. (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

requirements.summary: Register a new /pickup-point-dashboard route in the TanStack HashRouter, protected by RequireAuth, rendering the new placeholder page.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /pickup-point-dashboard while logged out shows the existing login gate (RequireAuth behavior).
Navigating to /pickup-point-dashboard while logged in renders the new placeholder pickup-point dashboard page.
The new route is included in the router's routeTree so it is reachable at runtime.
No other routes, dashboards, or role-approval guards are changed in this step.

file_operations.description: Add an import for PickupPointDashboardPage, define a new route at path '/pickup-point-dashboard' that renders the page inside RequireAuth (use the existing RequireAuth guard provided by the authorization setup; no additional approval/role gating in this step), and include the route in routeTree so it is reachable. Keep all other routes unchanged. (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)
